item.title: Fly tipped fire place near driveway, 31st December
item.description:
One of our neighbours noticed a white van later in the evening on Saturday get something out of their van. She thought it was a delivery driver but only noticed when it had drived off that they had dumped an old fireplace outside my property. We have been away and have only returned today (31st December). The neighbours moved it slightly as it was blocking the driveway. Please could it be picked up as soon as you can. Many thanks, Mark

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter everywhere in every angle of the field, 31st December
item.description:
This field is used by some children to play football, and dogs often walk here. There are remains of broken glass bottles, syringes and needles from drug users, litter everywhere, a shopping trolley abandoned at the entrance, even a broken TV screen was dumped there but kindly taken away by a bromley rubbish collector. Litter is scattered under shrubs, trees and the bins are always overflowing. Passers by have no respect for the area and seeing it dirty only encourages them to continue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Franklin Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Santander Bike abandoned in Old Farm Road West, Sidcup, DA15 8AG, 31st December
item.description:
This bike has been left on the pavement, leaning against a wall, almost opposite my house. It has been there for 4 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Old Farm Road West, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole outside number 66, 31st December
item.description:
Good morning, I am writing to report a pothole that has reappeared on the road (please see attached photo). This pothole was previously repaired, however the repair appears to have been carried out poorly and has now failed. The pothole has been present again for approximately a month and is continuing to deteriorate. It poses a risk to vehicles, cyclists and pedestrians, and I would appreciate it if this could be inspected and repaired properly as soon as possible. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Kind regards,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Petersham Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suitcase and bag dumped in alley, 31st December
item.description:
Blue suitcase and black sack dumped in alley between 115 and 117 Herbert Road just above Herbert Terrace. Thank you for all your help in dealing with the increasing amount of fly-tipping on our road. Happy New Year!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Herbert Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet
